revision.text:
{{Wireless embedded system |brand=Asante |model=SmartHub AWRT-600N |revision= |upc=662730008413 |ean= |asin=B003EM4RF0 |price= |est_release_date= |fcc_date=12/08/2008 |manuf_country=China |is_manuf=No |manuf=Gemtek |manuf_model=WRTR-241N |manuf_rev= |availability= |type=wireless router |fcc_id=MXF-R971009GN |ic_id= |us_id= |pwr_v=12 |pwr_amp=1 |pwr_conn=barrel |pwr_barrel_outer= |pwr_barrel_inner= |pwr_barrel_len= |pwr_vac= |pwr_ac_hz= |pwr_pol= |pwr_poe= |cpu1_brand=Ralink |cpu1_model=RT2880 |cpu1_cspeed= |cpu2_brand= |cpu2_model= |cpu2_cspeed= |fla1= |fla1_brand= |fla1_model= |fla1_num= |fla2= |fla2_brand= |fla2_model= |fla2_num= |ram1= |ram1_brand= |ram1_model= |ram1_num= |ram2= |ram2_brand= |ram2_model= |ram2_num= |expansion_if_types= |expansion_pcmcia_num= |expansion_expresscard_num= |expansion_minipci_num= |expansion_minipcie_num= |expansion_usb_num= |jtag= |serial= |wi1_module= |wi1_module_if= |wi1_chip1_brand=Ralink |wi1_chip1_model=RT2880 |wi1_chip2_brand=Ralink |wi1_chip2_model=RT2850 |wi1_chip3_brand= |wi1_chip3_model= |wi1_802dot11_protocols=abgn |wi1_ant_conn= |wi1_txchains=2 |wi1_rxchains=3 |wi1_sstreams=2 |wi2_module= |wi2_module_if= |wi2_chip1_brand= |wi2_chip1_model= |wi2_chip2_brand= |wi2_chip2_model= |wi2_chip3_brand= |wi2_chip3_model= |wi2_802dot11_protocols= |wi2_ant_conn= |wi2_txchains= |wi2_rxchains= |wi2_sstreams= |eth_none= |eth_cpu=yes |eth_chip1_brand= |eth_chip1_model= |eth_chip2_brand= |eth_chip2_model= |eth_chip3_brand= |eth_chip3_model= |sw_cpu= |sw_brand=IC+ |sw_model=IP175E |lan_speed=100M |lan_ports=4 |wan_ports=1 |addl_chips= |flags= |stock_boot= |stock_os= |tp_firmware=OpenWrt (leitec) |802dot11_protocols=abgn |default_ssid=SmartHub-AWRT600N |default_ssid_regex=^SmartHub-AWRT600N$ |default_ip= |default_user= |default_pass= |oui= |oui_eth= }} This device is assumed to be a '''Gemtek''' WRTR-241N.. which was also sold as the [[Airlink101 AR725W]]. :This device probably has 4MB Flash and 32MB RAM like the AR725W.
[http://www.pcmag.com/article2/0,2817,2375425,00.asp PC Magazine review of the device] :Notes the processor as an RT2880F
WiGLE has multiple observations for '''SmartHub-AWRT600N''' (14 as of 01/16/2013), but none use 5GHz channels. It is still presumed to be the default SSID.
==Additional external links== *[http://github.com/leitec/openwrt-leitec As the AR725W is, this router should be supported by an unofficial fork of '''OpenWRT''' (''openwrt-leitec'')]
